lead_paragraph: ARMENTO--William J.,101, died in San Mateo, CA. Survived by Elvina, his wife of 70 years, daughters Valerie, Anne (Patrick Dunn), Janice (James Scherba) and Lisa Armento, seven grandchildren, Jill Armento Curran of Greenwich, Connecticut, numerous nieces and nephews. Bill graduated from Stuyvesant in 1931, from CCNY in 1935, and earned an MS in civil engineering at Columbia in 1949. He taught engineering courses at CCNY from 1938 through 1950 as well as evening classes at Brooklyn Polytechnic. In the 1930's he worked for Madigan-Hyland designing the upper levels of the Henry Hudson and Whitestone Bridges and supervised construction of the East River (FDR) Drive. At Parsons, Brinkerhoff he worked on designs for the Bay Area Rapid Transit System and relocated to San Francisco in 1963. A licensed professional engineer in five states and a licensed land surveyor in New York, he served on the New York State Board of Examiners for Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors. Eternal tribute at www.ssofunerals.com 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  ARMENTO, WILLIAM J.
